storyInfo: The last communion begins. Federico fires a warning shot to interrupt the argument. The Laterans each act on their own.

attributes.content: Good morning, Your Excellency.
attributes.name: Jori

attributes.content: Good morning again, Jori. Please, see to the others.
attributes.name: Abbot

attributes.content: Yes, Father.
attributes.name: Jori

attributes.content: Father Abbot, we...
attributes.name: Frightened Sarkaz

attributes.content: Much has happened of late, Sural. I understand your unease.
attributes.name: Abbot

attributes.content: Should we have come? Would those people from Laterano...
attributes.name: Frightened Sarkaz

attributes.content: It'll be alright.
attributes.name: Abbot

attributes.content: All who dwell in the Sanctilaminium Ambrosii are welcome in this chapel. That's how things have been for the last ten years.
attributes.name: Abbot

attributes.content: Sit up front, Sural. Just like always. No need to worry.
attributes.name: Abbot

attributes.content: Laterans do not interrupt a communion in progress.
attributes.name: Abbot

attributes.content: Please, take your seats.
attributes.name: Abbot

attributes.content: Join me in a moment of prayer. Wait, listen, and feel the peace and tranquility.
attributes.name: Abbot

attributes.content: I am Stefano Torregrossa, abbot of the Sanctilaminium Ambrosii.
attributes.name: Abbot

attributes.content: The words 'believer' and 'kin' are not used here.
attributes.name: Abbot

attributes.content: The mundane world has certain conceptions of the Sankta and the Sarkaz. Order and chaos. Peace and war. Angels and devils. We share the same conceptions.
attributes.name: Abbot

attributes.content: Our halos and horns are our most distinctive features, symbols etched in the very essence of our life. Our existence alone draws the attention of others.
attributes.name: Abbot

attributes.content: Yet we have seen the sun rise and set thousands of times together, and we gather here today to partake in communion, to share shelter and blessing.
attributes.name: Abbot

attributes.content: We have spent varying lengths of time here at the abbey, but even the newcomers amongst us have been here for more than a decade.
attributes.name: Abbot

attributes.content: For a much longer time, we had no way of knowing whether we had been abandoned or forgotten. We did not know what perils the path ahead would hold, that we would meet at a fork of which no one could know.
attributes.name: Abbot

attributes.content: We had conflicts. We had secrets. But we tried to accept one another.
attributes.name: Abbot

attributes.content: We know the names and habits of everyone in this chapel. We shared food and sheltered one another from wind and rain.
attributes.name: Abbot

attributes.content: We fought beasts and bandits together. We built houses and paved roads together. We plowed fields and harvested them together.
attributes.name: Abbot

attributes.content: We were brothers and sisters. We loved each other, and treasured one another's peace and happiness as our own.
attributes.name: Abbot

attributes.content: The bonds that tie us went beyond any physical trait or telepathic connection, transcended any differences in faith or ideology.
attributes.name: Abbot

attributes.content: Yet, after having endured the long night, it was the fleeting cold before the dawn that overcame us.
attributes.name: Abbot

attributes.content: The nuncios from Laterano, the Executors, and... emissaries from a distant realm... they all had their own plans, brought new hope, and forced painful choices.
attributes.name: Abbot

attributes.content: We lost our battered pillars to fire, and our respected and trusted brothers to conflict...
attributes.name: Abbot

attributes.content: Stefano Torregrossa sought that which was most good, even if the answer was an unproven one. For this, I seek your forgiveness.
attributes.name: Abbot

attributes.content: Sanctilaminium Ambrosii is not Paradise. But it is our common home.
attributes.name: Abbot

attributes.content: I have faith that we will make the same choice.
attributes.name: Abbot

attributes.content: Now, I invite you to take communion.
attributes.name: Abbot

attributes.content: Does it hurt?
attributes.name: Lemuen

attributes.content: Could be worse.
attributes.name: Oren

attributes.content: You put on a brave face, but I can hear your teeth chattering.
attributes.name: Serpilia

attributes.content: The barrel of a rifle will never be worse than a bullet.
attributes.name: Oren

attributes.content: You can have one of those, too, if you want.
attributes.name: Lemuen

attributes.content: I can feel your seething anger.
attributes.name: Oren

attributes.content: You're angry that I violated the purity of your faith. That proves you're thinking as a Lateran.
attributes.name: Oren

attributes.content: Your mission is to bring the Sanctilaminium Ambrosii back to Laterano, and to help the lost Lateran kin there. My mission is to preserve what makes Laterano, Laterano.
attributes.name: Oren

attributes.content: Set your sentimentality aside, Lemuen. We're in agreement here.
attributes.name: Oren

attributes.content: Enough with your sophistry.
attributes.name: Lemuen

attributes.content: Did you learn it from the Victorian nobles, or Columbian merchants, Legatus Oren?
attributes.name: Lemuen

attributes.content: I said it, the sudden appearance of beasts will frighten wanderers. I'm not going to stand by and watch a massacre happen.
attributes.name: Lemuen

attributes.content: The commandos will be in position any moment now. You can't stop me.
attributes.name: Oren

attributes.content: I can incapacitate you, then deal with them.
attributes.name: Lemuen

attributes.content: You may have surprised me once, but it won't work again. Not unless you actually put a bullet in my brain.
attributes.name: Oren

attributes.content: Is that so?
attributes.name: Lemuen

attributes.content: Lemuen? Oren? Don't tell me you're really going to—
attributes.name: Serpilia

attributes.content: A loud crack interrupts the exchange.

Again, and then again, before anyone could react, so loud that it sounds like the patron firearm was being fired right next to their ears. They could not even hear their own heartbeats for a few seconds.
The projectile leaves a long trail in the damp morning air.
I am Executor Federico of the Laterano Notarial Hall. That was a warning shot.
attributes.name: Federico

attributes.content: Cardinal Aide Lemuen, Legatus Oren, and Technician Serpilia of the Sixth Tribunal. I command you to cease your pointless altercation at once.
attributes.name: Federico

attributes.content: I see no need to understand your positions or mediate your conflict.
attributes.name: Federico

attributes.content: The mission remains incomplete. Newly emerged factors continue to present a risk of escalation. This monastery needs order.
attributes.name: Federico

attributes.content: If there is no contradiction between you, yet conflict remains unresolved; if empathy is not enough to prevent a community from disintegrating...
attributes.name: Federico

attributes.content: Then I will be order.
attributes.name: Federico

attributes.content: That warning shot was also intended for the special forces outside. Lateran troops will not enter the Sanctilaminium Ambrosii without my express authorization.
attributes.name: Federico

attributes.content: You were the one who deployed them, Oren. You will restrain them. Order them to pull back one kilometer and stand by.
attributes.name: Federico

attributes.content: Lemuen and Serpilia. The two of you have been in contact with the Sankta and Sarkaz populations here. You will reassure them and prevent the situation from escalating.
attributes.name: Federico

attributes.content: Meet me in the chapel once you have finished your task. Richele has uncovered a lead and is following it.
attributes.name: Federico

attributes.content: I will find the one responsible for this situation.
attributes.name: Federico

attributes.content: You will act now.
attributes.name: Federico

attributes.content: Now, I invite you to take communion.
Guess I didn't make it in time.
attributes.name: Richele

attributes.content: Richele peeks through a gap in the door and sees the gathered crowd return to their seats with sacramental bread and wine.
In the chancel, the aging abbot looks up toward the door, almost as though he is looking at Richele.
Richele thinks for a moment, then closes the door. He thinks for another moment, then takes out a spare gun grip, which he uses to latch the door handle.
Almost. All that's left is to wait for it to... finish.
attributes.name: Richele

attributes.content: Hm? Did Federico run into trouble? I guess I'm the only one taking care of things here now.
attributes.name: Richele

attributes.content: What a chore.
attributes.name: Richele

attributes.content: I should have taken the mission to search for the missing Legatus in Sargon. It might have been a little far, but dealing with the people of the sand has got to be less complicated.
attributes.name: Richele

attributes.content: Am I doomed to be a workaholic? Truly, our fate lies not in our hands.
attributes.name: Richele

attributes.content: Let's see... patron firearm in good working order.
attributes.name: Richele

attributes.content: If everyone inside... is one bullet per head enough? Don't tell me I'll have to use my fists...
attributes.name: Richele

attributes.content: I should apply for paid leave once I get back to Laterano. The Notarial Hall had better approve it, considering my workload.
attributes.name: Richele
